Entries.default: A light, brine-scented breeze plays at you as the vine-shrouded passage to the sea looms ahead.

The waters near the cavern calm to usher you through the passage. 

After a few long minutes in the cool darkness of the cave, you're returned to the open sea.
The crew look to you nervously as you bring the ship near the cave again. Even as you approach, however, the swells begin again, repulsing you back towards the open sea.
You return to the secret cave entrance to Kazuwari, and the waters guide you through the passage and into the island's central lake.

The island stretches for miles to the north and south. Waves crash against sheer, rocky cliffs, while sea birds dive like falling javelins into the water before taking to the air again. Thick, verdant jungle crowns the cliffs, and vines fall from it like a veil. Above the jungle, even higher mountain peaks rise, grasping for the clouds.

[Specified 0] salutes you as the crew pulls the dinghy from the water.

"Orders, captain?"

The island stretches for miles to the north and south. Waves crash against sheer, rocky cliffs, while sea birds dive like falling javelins into the water before taking to the air again. Thick, verdant jungle crowns the cliffs, and vines fall from it like a veil. Above the jungle, even higher mountain peaks rise, grasping for the clouds.

[Specified 1] stands beside you, gesturing to the dark shadow that slices down the cliffside like an ugly wound and the deep blue thread of water that runs from it like blood.

"That's a cave, and no small one. The dark water indicates depth - some manner of trench. Might make for a natural waterway, if you're willing to risk it."
"Take the ship forward."
"Thoughts, [Specified 0]?"
"Is this a Príncipi trap, Serafen?"
[Leave] "No. Sail us to deeper waters."
Orders echo below the hatches, and the engines groan to life as [Player Ship] plows forward into the dark water.

"It's like nothing I've ever done before, but that ain't exactly uncommon in your employ, captain."

Brow furrowed, [Specified 0] peers across the water.

"I reckon it's safe enough, long as we take it slow and easy."

"Nay, cap. Least not one I've heard tell of."

Shading his eyes with an open hand to his brow, the orlan scans the cliffs.
"Want to send your bird to scout, Maia?"
"Bird, go make yourself useful." Maia points and Ishiza takes flight at once with an eager screech.

You watch as Ishiza disappears against the dark shadow of the cliffs. A few minutes later he comes speeding back and alights on Maia's outstretched forearm. She pulls him in close and Ishiza buries his head in Maia's chest.
"Something scared him, captain. Little guy's shaking like a palm frond on a windy day." Maia furrows her brow and feeds Ishiza an extra helping of rabbit meat from her pack.
Orders echo across the planks and rigging creaks as [Player Ship] ploughs forward into the dark water.
The cliffs loom closer, and the cacophony of cascading water from the shoreline rises above the din of the deck...

A swell of water pulses from the island and the ship shudders and lists, sending shouting crew stumbling. Your stomach sinks as a hard jostle and unpleasant scraping sound suggests the ship has run up against the side of the trench.

As you watch, the island seems to recede before you... you've been pushed back out to sea.
"Sweet Ondra, have mercy!" [Specified 2] shouts, clinging to the mast.
"What in Wael's holy name," [Specified 1] mutters, "was that?"
"I say this tide is not of my mother's design. It is the work of watershapers." Tekēhu gestures overboard to the churning waves.
The crew look to you for orders...
"Are we in danger?"
"Do you think you can counteract it?"
"Are there watershapers out here?"
"Thank you."
"If they wanted to sink us they would have done it, I say." Tekēhu thumbs his chin and considers.
"I cannot. There must be several shapers working in tandem, and even Ngati's favorite son finds himself outmatched." Tekēhu sighs and shrugs.
"If the guild dispatched them then no one told me of it. Unless this is something else. Most troubling, I say." Tekēhu sighs through his nose.

[Specified 1] stands beside you, gesturing to the dark shadow that slices down the cliffside like an ugly wound and the deep blue thread of water that runs from it like blood.

"That's a cave, and no small one. The dark water indicates depth - some manner of trench. Might make for a natural waterway, if you're willing to risk it."
"The Faces should see us safely through. Forward."
"Thoughts, [Specified 0]?"
[Leave] "No. Sail us to deeper waters."

"It's like nothing I've ever done before, but that ain't exactly uncommon in your employ, captain."

Brow furrowed, [Specified 0] peers across the water.

"I reckon it's safe enough, long as we take it slow and easy."

You make out movement in the darkness of the cave ahead, followed closely by cool, shimmering light, like the sun reflected from the surface of the sea. The waters immediately calm, smooth like glass, and the ship picks up speed as the current whisks it into the waiting cave.
Orders echo below the hatches, and the engines groan to life as [Player Ship] plows forward into the dark water.
Orders echo across the planks and rigging creaks as [Player Ship] ploughs forward into the dark water.
The cliffs loom closer, and the cacophony of cascading water from the shoreline rises above the din of the deck...
You enter a massive cavern, the roof so far above as to pose no danger.
"Belay that superstitious talk, sailor."
"Bite that tongue, [Specified 2], lest I relieve you of it!"
"Not long now, hands. Stay calm."
[Say nothing.]

The cavern lightens, and an immense crack of light appears as you round a bend. You sail smoothly through it and onto a lake at the interior of the island. Cliffs rise above you, festooned with wild foliage, and the sounds of nature echo on the air.

You order anchor dropped and a skiff prepared to bear you ashore.
A dark shadow separates the cliffside like an ugly wound, and a deep blue thread of water runs from it like blood.
"Take us back to the open water, [Specified 0]."
"Any trouble while I was ashore?"
"Actually, I should return to the island."

"Aye-aye, captain!" [Specified 0] snaps out another salute. "All hands to stations, we're pulling anchor!"

A cheer goes up across the ship.

"Nay, not a peep, captain." 

"There was that godsdamned bird!" shouts [Specified 1].

[Specified 0] frowns. "Aye, there was that. Had a hawk of some kind, wingspan the size of an aumaua's arms. Attacked some of the hands while they were fishing. Strange, sure, but [Specified 2] drove it off with a batten."

[Specified 0] blinks. "A... aye, captain. We'll have the dinghy back in the water in a tic."

You return to land.

From the inner lake, the passage to the sea seems half-hidden by a drapery of vines. As you approach, you see the waters calm, then begin to slide away into the darkness.

The boat gains speed as it enters the cavern.
[Specified 3] glances at you. "Not sure I'll ever get used to this kind of thing, captain."
"Steady as she goes, [Specified 0]."
"Grow a backbone, [Specified 3]."
"Enough strangeness out of you, [Specified 4]."
[Say nothing.]
"Aye-aye, captain." [Specified 0] scowls at the other two sailors. They say nothing further.

"I ain't scared!" [Specified 3] stammers. "Just saying it's strange is all."

A few other sailors laugh.
[Specified 4] merely grins.
After several long minutes of darkness, the ship bursts from the passage. Open water to the horizon beckons before you.
"Take us out to sea."
"I'm returning to shore."

A dark shadow slices down the cliffside like an ugly wound, and a deep blue thread of water runs from it like blood.

A cavern.
[Return the way you came.]
A sound like thunder rends the air, and the deck comes apart beneath your feet. For an impossibly long moment the world spins around you, and then you plunge into the water.

You hang in the water, stunned, pieces of lumber and steel sinking around you. Too weak to swim, you watch the surface recede.

Darkness claims you.
"Sweet, merciful Ondra," [Specified 2] mutters at your side.

[Specified 4] chuckles, drawing a few uneasy glances from other members of the crew. "This is nothing next to the stranger things that lie ahead."

"That's just great," [Specified 3] mutters.
